org.quackbot.hooks
Class Hook

java.lang.Object
  org.pircbotx.hooks.ListenerAdapter<Bot>
      org.quackbot.hooks.Hook
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.pircbotx.hooks.Listener<Bot>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Command, CoreQuackbotHook, JSHookLoader.JSHookWrapper, QuackbotLogHook
public abstract class Hook
extends org.pircbotx.hooks.ListenerAdapter<Bot>

The Hook interface is what all Hooks must implement to be added to the stack. This interface has one method, #run(Quackbot.hook.HookList, Quackbot.Bot, Quackbot.info.BotEvent) , that is called during stack execution. See HookManager for an explanation on what a hook is and how hooks are treated and executed.

Author:
Leon Blakey

Constructor Detail

Hook

public Hook()
Create a hook with the class name as the hook name. In some cases this is not desirable, eg plugins that wrap the underlying plugin in a customized hook class or an anonymous class

Hook

public Hook(String name)
Create a hook with the given name. File is null

Parameters:
name - The name to use for this Hook

Hook

public Hook(String fileLocation,
            String name)
Create an hook with the given file and name

Parameters:
fileLocation - The file that this Hook came from
name - The name to use for this Hook

Hook

public Hook(org.pircbotx.hooks.Listener listener)
Wrap an Listener, allowing it to be easily used in Quackbot

Parameters:
listener - The listener to wrap
